content.question:
A realtor collected data from a random sample of <math alttext="29" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>29</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> houses for sale in a certain town. The scatterplot shows the size of each house, in square feet, and the asking price, in thousands of dollars. The least-squares regression line is also shown.

Based on the recorded data, the realtor created the following regression equation to predict asking price, in thousands of dollars, based on the size, in square feet, of the house.

<math alttext="predicted asking price, equals 35.050 plus 0.096 (size of house)" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>predicted asking price</mtext><mo>=</mo><mn>35.050</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>0.096</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mtext>size of house</mtext><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

Which of the following provides the best interpretation of the slope of the regression line?

choices.label: For each additional square foot, the predicted asking price of a house in this town increases by <math alttext="$96" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>96</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
For each additional square foot, the predicted asking price of a house in this town increases by <math alttext="$35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

For each additional square foot, the predicted asking price of a house in this town increases by <math alttext="$0.096" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>0.096</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

For each additional <math alttext="$1,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>1</mn><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of asking price, the predicted size of a house increases by <math alttext="35" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>35</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> square feet.

For each additional <math alttext="$1,000" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>1</mn><mtext>,000</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of asking price, the predicted size of a house increases by <math alttext="0.096" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.096</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> square feet.

content.answer: For each additional square foot, the predicted asking price of a house in this town increases by <math alttext="$96" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>96</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
